Class Visualizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Visualizer

  • public class Visualizer
extends java.lang.Object
    Visualizer for the ant colony problem. It keeps an internal representation of the spatial configuration of the graph, and includes a method to update the visual display with the position of all ants and the levels of sugar and pheromones in each node or edge.

    The visualizer is semantically associated with an instance of Simulator that has the same graph and list of ants as the visualizer. In other words, the constructor to Visualizer should be called with the same Graph and Ant[] arguments as the constructor to Simulator used in the same simulation.

    This requirement is motivated by the fact that Visualizer is an auxiliary class, whose methods should in principle belong to Simulator objects; the separation in two classes is only related to the purpose of this project, as implementing the methods included in Visualizer does not fall under the expected learning outcomes of this course.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Visualizer

        public Visualizer(Graph graph,
                  boolean isGrid,
                  Node start,
                  Ant[] ants)
        Constructor: takes a graph and a node in the graph and builds an internal representation of it.

        Precondition: the start node must be part of the graph and the graph must be connected.

        Parameters:
        graph - the graph to visualize
        isGrid - whether the graph is a rectangular grid of nodes at least 3 by 3
        start - a node in the graph
        ants - a reference to the array of ants used throughout the simulation
